definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Under the promoting of network and globalization, the world of network goods are coming.
sentences.chinese: 在网络化和全球化的促动下，网货世界来临了。

sentences.english: It is the promoter of the main trend combining rites and law of Chinese tr…
sentences.chinese: 春秋决狱是中国传统法律文化礼法融合主潮的促动者。

sentences.english: Other factors that propel them from thought to action remain to be identified.
sentences.chinese: 其他促动人们变想法为行动的因素犹待研究。

sentences.english: Avery and Sawyer are more creative and less motivated by short-term results.
sentences.chinese: 埃弗瑞和索耶更具创造力，不大被短期结果所促动。

definition: to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
to induce/to promote/to urge/to impel/to bring about/to provoke/to drive (sb to do sth)/to catalyze/to actuate/to contribute to (some development)
to bolster/to give a boost to (the economy etc)
to drive/to propel/drive (vehicle wheel)/drive mechanism (tape or disk)/device driver (computing software)
to promote (an idea or cause)/to advance/boost
